job_title: Patient Access Representative in Houston, TX
pros: Nice office environment with spacious desks, benefits after three months on job.
cons: This is a "non-profit that runs like a corporation" as the head of HR puts it, and it shows in low staff and patient retention rates. Care should not be corporatized as corporatization does not do much for efficiency in practice as it intends in theory. Also, the HR training video being the movie Crash should have been the first red flag heeded. Because of issues at various points in the organizational structure and—granted—increased volume of patients with complex care needs, workflows change in frequent and frustrating ways.

pros:
Great Mission. The majority of the company cares very much about ensuring we do our best to provide patients with a great experience. 


My team of recruiters was great. Working together was never an issue and we always had each other's backs.
cons:
The HR Department is falling apart. Bad hires causing good people to feel unappreciated,  burnt out, and needing an escape. Employees don't have a voice or the confidence to speak up for fear of backlash. 

Micromanaging everything. Since the HR department got their first CHRO, the team morale has gone down the drain. Everyone is under the microscope. Also doesn't help that the CEO and CHRO are close and complaints are ignored.

pros: 1. Working to improve the access to healthcare in a way that was affordable especially to communities that are so often so underpromoted.

pros: This is an amazing company!
cons: There are no cons I can think of.

pros:
Patients can be reached from all over the city, and the Legacy team continues to provide excellent services to each of them along the way.  The Legacy BRAND is increasingly stronger with every day.  As new locations emerge and more services can be performed, the Legacy team is never hindered with a lack of improvement.  There is a great team portion for many different facets like: Behavioral Health; Public Health Education; Nutrition Services; Pediatric Help; Vaccinations; Optometry
These are just a portion of the services provided with my location, and there is never a question as to what new service and the quality of such will be.
cons: It is quite difficult to get each and every patient to make their appointments, and it is quite disheartening when we are unable to provide for those who are absent.

review_title: Wanted to Believe in the Lie
job_title: Contact Center Representative in Houston, TX
pros: PTO with a catch. Schedule.
cons: Management or whatever they call it. Employees makes it hard for patients to get anything done the right way. Friends and Family members welcomed and overlooked. Major Conflict of interest. HR friends with management hard to  be taken seriously cause they will cover for them. Gossip is rampant. Sites treated like other companies. No communication. Lazy employee's. Days to get a reply to simple questions. Unable to take responsibility. Unable to admit wrong. Sets up employees to fail. No training. Management involved in much of the gossip. Employee confidential pay info leaked. Serious matters taken too lightly. Management scared to get on phone with upset patients. When asking for help looked at with the why are you bothering me face. Prefer to discuss what to eat for lunch or what's on social media than actually work. Could go on and on and on and on.

job_title: Contact Center Representative in Houston, TX
pros: You can pay for onsite gym, and better parking at the corporate drive location,
cons: Lots of workload you need to know KIPP, all of their locations, confirm appointments between calls, and assist in scheduling, also some of the staff may contact you in an unprofessional manner as you are basically an off-site receptionist for all of the departments, also be warned the receptionist will have new clients call you to register rather than actually do that themselves even if they are physically in the clinic.  You have to explain your call times on a sheet of paper if it goes over a set time frame.  In summary you are essentially working in a matrix management style while being very close to the span of control and you will feel it regularly.

review_title: GREAT EXPERIENCE!!! Would definitely recommend working here if you can.
pros: Mangers were very nice. A lot of opportunity to make a difference. Clients were very responsive if you showed you genuinely cared. I felt there was ample opportunity to move up the ladder if you proved yourself. Overall a great, GREAT, work environment. You'll definitely miss the people there once you leave!
cons: Pay was not the best but the great work environment made up for it.

pros: Good PTO but there is a catch to it.
cons: These people have ZERO MORAL COMPASS. Two of the "higher ups administrators" are former big boys from Enron that did not serve as much time as they should have. CMS/Medicare/Medicaid has also been investigating them for a few years now but they are so arrogant and cocky that they really believe they can get away with robbing our great state of Texas of funds.
